subject: Data Processor Has Rapid Growth

Breaking News....... Record Sales Announced by Quintek Technologies, Inc ( OTC:BB: QTEK)









NASDAQ

  |  


NYSE

  |  


AMEX

  |  


OTC:BB















QUINTEK 
 
  


















Quintek Announces Record Sales 
										Results for Month of May


										6/20/2007

  


  










Expects Revenue Increases 
										for Quarter Ending June 31, 2007

HUNTINGTON BEACH, CA, 
										Jun 20, 2007 (MARKET WIRE via COMTEX 
										News 

Network) 
										-- 


Quintek Technologies, Inc. (OTCBB: 
										QTEK), a global provider of 

Business 
										Process Outsourcing (BPO) and 
										best-of-breed technology consulting 
										services, announced that it should see 
										continued revenue increases for the 
										quarter ending June 31, 2007. The 
										increasing revenue forecast follows a 
										49% increase in revenues for the quarter 
										ending March 31, 2007 from the quarter 
										ending December 31, 2006. These results 
										will mark two consecutive postings of 
										quarter on quarter revenue increases for 
										the company. The Company also reported 
										that their sales revenue for the month 
										of May was at record levels. 



In the past few months Quintek has 
										announced that it has added several new 
										full time additions to its staff. 
										The result is that the Company has 
										effectively added over 60 years of 
										cumulative experience in technology 
										sales and consulting with a core focus 
										on the enterprise document management 
										space. These new team members further 
										strengthen Quintek's core team and will 
										help expand its offerings. Leading this 
										team is James Kernan, Quintek's newly 
										appointed CEO who has brought revenue 
										increases of several thousand percent to 
										a number of the 

companies 
										for which he has worked. 


James Kernan, Quintek CEO, 
										stated, "We are focused on Quintek 
										becoming the best company in its space 
										and we are beginning to see substantial 
										progress in the financial results. These 
										results indicate the surge in business 
										we are experiencing from existing 
										customers and a material increase in new 
										business." 


Andrew Haag, Quintek CFO, commented, 
										"For the month of May Quintek booked 
										record 

sales 
										revenue. Our financial strength is 
										improving as we grow our business and 
										this is clear from our results.. The 
										Company is beginning to experience the 
										consecutive quarter over quarter growth 
										that is needed to take it to the next 
										level." Haag added, "As we continue to 
										deliver improving financial results our 
										exposure to professional and individual 
										investors should increase and draw their 
										attention." 


About Quintek Technologies, Inc.



Quintek Technologies, Inc. (OTCBB: 
										QTEK), through its wholly owned 
										subsidiaries Quintek Services, Inc. (QSI), 
										and Sapphire Consulting Services, Inc., 
										provides services to enable Fortune 500 
										and Global 2000 corporations to reduce 
										costs and maximize revenues. 



QSI delivers Business Process 
										Outsourcing (BPO) services and 
										solutions that enable companies to 
										secure and manage their key data 
										processing demands with optimal 
										efficiency and minimal costs. As a 
										next-generation technology company, 
										Quintek is unhindered by outdated 
										information technology systems, and thus 
										is able to deploy best-of-breed 
										solutions in all aspects of BPO. 
										Forester Research, Inc. estimates that 
										the market for BPO services will grow 
										from $19 billion in 2004 to $146 billion 
										in 2008. Business Insights estimated the 
										BPO market as the fastest growing area 
										of the IT services sector. Growing at 8% 
										annually it is expected to grow from 
										$112.1 billion is 2005 to $144 billion 
										in 2008. 


										Sapphire Consulting Services, Inc. 
										offers a broad range of supply chain 
										management consulting services. Sapphire 
										assists organizations to create a higher 
										level of customer satisfaction, enhance 
										supply chain capability and achieve 
										consistent competitive advantage through 
										reduced product cost, reduced inventory 
										investment and improved supply chain 
										security. A study by IDC found the SCM 
										services market will expand from $26.1 
										billion in 2002 to $40.5 billion in 
										2007, representing a five-year compound 
										annual growth rate (CAGR) of 9.2%.
										


										For more information, visit http://www.quintek.com.
										


										This press release contains 
										forward-looking information within the 
										meaning of Section 21E of the Securities 
										Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the

										of the company's business, as well as 
										statements that include the word 
										"believe" or similar expressions. Such 
										forward-looking statements involve known 
										and unknown risks, uncertainties and

										Quintek to differ materially from those 
										implied or expressed by such 
										forward-looking statements. Such factors 
										include, among others, the risk factors 
										included in Quintek's Annual Report on 
										Form 10-KSB for the fiscal year ended 
										June 30, 2006 and any subsequent reports 
										filed with the SEC under the Exchange

										date first set forth above and Quintek

										results could differ materially from 
										those anticipated due to factors such as 
										the lack of capital, inability to timely 
										develop products or services, inability 
										to deliver products or services when 
										ordered, inability of potential 
										customers to pay for ordered products or 
										services, and political and economic 
										risks inherent in domestic and 
										international trade. 


										SOURCE: Quintek Technologies, Inc.
